byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Family of slain 12-year-old Tamir Rice, along with many others, express anger toward Cuyahoga County prosecutor Timothy J McGinty, who has steadily approved release of grand jury evidence that seems to mitigate culpability of Officer Timothy Loehmann; steady stream of material, including testimony that rookie officer had 'no choice' but to use force against Rice, has convinced many that no indictment will be issued.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor is releasing material favorable to the officers involved in the Cleveland boy’s death, and the family fears there is an effort to avoid indictments.

headline.main: Tamir Rice’s Family Clashes With Prosecutor Over Police Killing
headline.print_headline: Family Clashes With Prosecutor in Police Killing

snippet: The prosecutor is releasing material favorable to the officers involved in the Cleveland boy’s death, and the family fears there is an effort to avoid indictments.
